sen.j: アマツヒコネは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: "Amatsuhikone" is a god (Shinto) appearing in Japanese Mythology.
"Amatsuhikone" is a god (Shinto) appearing in Japanese Mythology.
Amatsuhikone is a god (Shinto) appearing in Japanese Mythology.

sen.j: 古事記では天津日子根命、日本書紀では天津彦根命と書かれる。
sen.e: It is written 天津日子根命 in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and 天津彦根命 in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).
It is written 天津日子根命 in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and 天津彦根命 in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).
It is written 天津日子根命 in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and 天津彦根命 in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: アマテラスとスサノオの誓約の際に、天照大神の八尺勾玉の五百箇の御統の珠から生まれた五柱の男神のうちの一柱である。
sen.e: It is one of the five male gods born from the Iotsu Misumaru no tama necklace of the Yasaka no magatama Bead of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess), when Amaterasu and Susano took their oath.
It is one of the five male gods born from the Iotsu Misumaru no tama necklace of the Yasaka no magatama Bead of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess), when Amaterasu and Susano took their oath.
It is one of the five male gods born from the Iotsu Misumaru no tama necklace of the Yasaka no magatama Bead of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess), when Amaterasu and Susano took their oath.

sen.j: 古事記や日本書紀本文ほかでは3番目に生まれ、天照大神の物種より生まれたので天照大神の御子神であるとされる。
sen.e: In Kojiki, the main body of Nihonshoki, etc., it was the third to be born, and since it was born from a fundamental element of Amaterasu Omikami, it was considered a mikogami (the child god in a shrine where parent child gods are enshrined) of Amaterasu Omikami.

In Kojiki, the main body of Nihonshoki, etc., was the third to be born, and since it was born from a fundamental element of Amaterasu Omikami, it was considered to be a mikogami (the child god in a shrine where parent child gods are enshrined) of Amaterasu Omikami.

In Kojiki and the main body of Nihonshoki, etc., was the third to be born, and since it was born from a fundamental element of Amaterasu Omikami, it was considered to be a mikogami (the child god in a shrine where parent child gods are enshrined) of Amaterasu Omikami.

sen.j: その後、神話の記述には登場しない。
sen.e: It does not appear in mythologies after this.
It does not appear in mythologies after this.
It does not appear in mythologies after this.

sen.j: アマツヒコネは多くの氏族の祖神とされている。
sen.e: Amatsuhikone is considered the soshin (ancestor honored as god) of many clans.
Amatsuhikone is considered the soshin (ancestor honored as god) of many clans.
Amatsuhikone is considered the soshin (ancestor honored as god) of many clans.

sen.j: 古事記によれば、河内国造・額田部湯坐連・茨城国造・大和田中直・山城国造・馬来田国造・道尻岐閇国造・周防国造・大和淹知造・高市県主・蒲生稲置・三枝部造らの祖神となっている。
sen.e: According to Kojiki, it is the soshin of Kawachi no kuninomiyatsuko, Nukatabe no yue no muraji, Ibaraki no kuninomiyatsuko, Nakanao OWADA (大和田中直), Yamashiro no kuninomiyatsuko, Umakuta no kuninomiyatsuko, Michinoshirinokihe no kuninomiyatsuko, Suwa no kuninomiyatsuko, Yamato no Amuchi no miyatsuko, Takechi agatanonushi, Gamo inagi, Sakikusabe no miyatsuko, etc.
sen.cmt: 大和田中直→Nakanao OWADA［正しい読み方が不明です］
sen.e: According to Kojiki, it is the soshin of Kawachi no kuninomiyatsuko, Nukatabe no yue no muraji, Ibaraki no kuninomiyatsuko, Nakanao OWADA (大和田中直), Yamashiro no kuninomiyatsuko, Umakuta no kuninomiyatsuko, Michinoshirinokihe no kuninomiyatsuko, Suwa no kuninomiyatsuko, Yamato no Amuchi no miyatsuko, Takechi agatanonushi, Gamo inagi, Sakikusabe no miyatsuko, etc.

According to Kojiki, it is the soshin of Kawachi no kuninomiyatsuko, Nukatabe no yue no muraji, Ibaraki no kuninomiyatsuko, Nakanao OWADA, Yamashiro no kuninomiyatsuko, Umakuta no kuninomiyatsuko, Michinoshirinokihe no kuninomiyatsuko, Suwa no kuninomiyatsuko, Yamato no Amuchi no miyatsuko, Takechi agatanonushi, Gamo inagi, Sakikusabe no miyatsuko, etc.
sen.cmt: (大和田中直)削除→読み方不明ハイフン削除

sen.j: これらは古くから天皇家に忠誠を誓った氏族であり、それらの氏族が崇敬していた神や祖神が習合されてアマツヒコネという神格が作られた（あるいはそれらの神々がアマツヒコネに習合された）と見られている。
sen.e: These are clans that pledged their loyalty to the Imperial Family from long ago, and it is believed that the gods and soshin that those clans worshipped were syncretized, creating a divinity called Amatsuhikone (or, those gods were syncretized with Amatsuhikone).

These are clans that pledged their loyalty to the Imperial Family from long ago, and it is believed that the gods and soshin that those clans worshipped were syncretized, creating a divinity called Amatsuhikone (or, those gods were syncretized with Amatsuhikone).

These are clans that pledged their loyalty to the Imperial Family from long ago, and it is believed that the gods and soshin that those clans worshipped were syncretized, creating a divinity called Amatsuhikone (or, those gods were syncretized with Amatsuhikone).

sen.j: 出雲国風土記では意宇郡屋代郷(現；島根県安来市)の地名由来の説明の中でアメノホヒに随伴して降臨した天津子命という神がこの地に社(ヤシロ)を立てたいといったので屋代(ヤシロ)という地名になったと伝えられているが、天津子が天津日子つまりアマツヒコネとする説がある。
sen.e: In the explanation of the origin of the geographic name of Yashiro go, Ou gun (present Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) in the Izumo no kuni fudoki (the topography of Izumo Province), a god called Amatsuko no mikoto who descended accompanying Amenohohi, wanted to build a yashiro (shrine building) in this location, leading to the name, Yashiro, but some say Amatsuko became Amatsuhiko, then Amatsuhikone.

In the explanation of the origin of the geographic name of Yashiro go, Ou gun (present Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) in the Izumo no kuni fudoki (the topography of Izumo Province), a god called Amatsuko no mikoto who descended accompanying Amenohohi, wanted to build a yashiro (shrine building) in this location, leading to the name, Yashiro, but some say Amatsuko became Amatsuhiko, then Amatsuhikone.

In the explanation of the origin of the geographic name of Yashiro go, Ou gun (present Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) in the Izumo no kuni fudoki (the topography of Izumo Province), a god called Amatsuko no mikoto who descended accompanying Amenohohi, wanted to build a yashiro (shrine building) in this location, leading to the name, Yashiro, but some say Amatsuko became Amatsuhiko, then Amatsuhikone.

sen.j: 神名の「ネ」は尊称で、「ヒコ」は「日神の子」の意と考えられるが、諸説ある。
sen.e: The 'ne' in the shinmei (name of god) is a honorific title, and 'hiko' is believed to stand for 'Hi no kami no ko (the child of the god of the sun),' but there are various theories.
The 'ne' in the shinmei (name of god) is a honorific title, and 'hiko' is believed to stand for 'Hi no kami no ko (the child of the god of the sun),' but there are various theories.
The 'ne' in the shinmei (name of god) is a honorific title, and 'hiko' is believed to stand for 'Hi no kami no ko' (the child of the god of the sun), but there are various theories.

sen.j: 日の神、海の神、風の神などとして信仰されており（これは多数の神が習合されたためと考えられる）、多度大社（三重県桑名市）などで祀られている。
sen.e: It is worshipped as the sun god, the sea god, the wind god, etc. (this is believed to be due to syncretization of many gods) and is enshrined at Tado taisha Shrine (Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture) and so on.

It is worshipped as the sun god, the sea god, the wind god, etc. (this is believed to be due to syncretization of many gods) and is enshrined at Tado taisha Shrine (Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture) and so on.

It is worshipped as the sun god, the sea god, the wind god, etc. (this is believed to be due to syncretization of many gods) and is enshrined at Tado-taisha Shrine (Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture) and so on.
